bibl.title: Papyri, Archives, and Patronage.
bibl.note: Two archives that are usually considered private or personal are those of the 4th-cent. Roman officer Abinnaeus and of his contemporary, the monk Paphnoutios. Examination of these archives shows that, while the dividing line between private and public documents was usually pretty clear, that between private and public archives is more difficult. - Non vidimus. Cf. APh 78 (2009) No. 10406.
bibl.seg: Teeter Timothy M., Papyri, Archives, and Patronage.

Two archives that are usually considered private or personal are those of the 4th-cent. Roman officer Abinnaeus and of his contemporary, the monk Paphnoutios. Examination of these archives shows that, while the dividing line between private and public documents was usually pretty clear, that between private and public archives is more difficult. - Non vidimus. Cf. APh 78 (2009) No. 10406.
